info.headline: Heat Advisory issued February 12 at 5:42AM PST until February 13 at 6:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PST SUNDAY... ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Heat Advisory, temperatures 86 to 93 degrees both Saturday and Sunday. For the Wind Advisory, northeast to east winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts 40 to 50 mph expected. Strongest winds expected through and below the passes. * WHERE...San Bernardino and Riverside County Valleys-The Inland Empire. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, until 6 PM PST Sunday. For the Wind Advisory, until 1 PM PST Saturday. * IMPACTS... Midday heat may cause heat illnesses to occur. Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects. Drink plenty of fluids, and stay out of the midday sun. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
